data.description:
Bountyverse 2024 is the follow on event to the successful GreenPill Festival we hosted in 2023. 
Where we had 100 attendees from 8 countries spend 5 days building and innovating in ReFi. 
With Bountyverse 2024 we are looking to organize a more structured approach with tangible outcomes at the end of the hackathon.
data.title: Bountyverse 2024

data.reason:
Unfortunately did not raise enough funds to conduct the event. 
We have developed the custom features within Impact Miner that will elevate the experience for Bountyverse 2024. Will attempt to organize the event in Q4 2024 subject to raising the required sponsorship funds.

data.description: Atlantis Impact Miner is a mobile application used by climate projects and communities to coordinate on climate action. It is also used for gather on ground climate impact data and to disburse last mile funds.
data.title: Launch Impact Miner v1.0

data.reason:
[Link to App on Google Playstore](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.company.atlantis&pcampaignid=web_share)

Features on released with Version 1.0
1. Physical and Digital Bounties 
2. Global Impact Index and Leaderboards 
3. Bounties based on Superpowers 
4. Impact Certificates 
5. Integrated EVM compatible tokens for Bounty Rewards 
6. Validator Feedback Mechanism
7. On-Chain attestation using Base

Integration of Hypercerts and Impact Miner.
data.title: Integration of Hypercerts with Impact Miner

data.name: Hypercerts
data.description:
This round aims to strengthen the Hypercerts Ecosystem to realize the vision of an interconnected impact funding network. We specifically want to support projects
1. that integrate hypercerts into existing funding platformssimilar to the hypercerts integration with Gitcoin,
2. that develop new applications like prize competitions leveraging the hypercerts infrastructure,
3. that build tooling to extent the functionality for multiple integrations and applications, such as Deresy to coordinate evaluators, or
4. that are tangible use cases piloting new functionalities, e.g. implementing retroactive funding rounds with hypercerts or using hyperboards.

Our project was selected to be part of the [GG20 Celo Public Goods Climate Bonus Round](https://mirror.xyz/celopg.eth/McicejfzasLM0nD5HKNdPukgQHvVrRVT2GiFwwzf8AA).


### **Celo Claim:**

Your project has produced research, media or other resources that support the Celo ecosystem., Your project has organised events and meetups that support the Celo ecosystem., Your project has an existing live dApp that you intend to deploy on Celo within this year.

At Atlantis we have developed two applications.

* Impact Foundry - to create impact projects and bounties. 

* Impact Miner - to execute and capture the impact data done on the projects and bounties. 

We have been developing the product to be interoperable, working with Solana and EVMs. Celo is one of the first EVMs we are introducing that helps projects holding Celo to have a new usecase where they can directly create on chain impact data and reward their contributors in Celo and apart from this we also are developing a mechanism where the bounty creator also has a choice to mint impact certificate for the project on the Celo network. 

[Atlantis Impact Tooling.png](https://storage.tally.so/private/Atlantis-Impact-Tooling.png?id=O4aY6a&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6Ik80YVk2YSIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTAwNzg1MX0.lL80clOx5ygSnU3VGJk1kMFkI8KrV3nNUDZQ1Ub1VRY&signature=fa68b79a9537ff0b9d3c39a503270dad3d4a4928ccfbf44d8de29e3f5bf660aa) - - -
data.title: Celo GG20 Climate Bonus Round

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Development of Web3 Grants tooling, Contributions to Web3 grants on-chain registry

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Web3 grants ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
At Atlantis we develop tools for last mile fund delivery, impact monitoring, reporting and verification. We have developed one product Impact Miner which is live now and being used by grantees for data collection and last mile fund delivery. The product aims to enrich impact claims made using Hypercerts, Karma Gap, Charmverse etc. 

Currently we are also involved in developing our second product -- the Impact Foundry, a web based application for web2 communities to setup DAOs, allocate grant funds and generate impact reports, it will also be useful for grantees  looking for 3rd party attestation (using EAS) services to further enhance their impact claims. 

With our suite of products we help the web3 ecosystem cultivate high quality grantee programs. With Improved UX we make it easy for grantees to generate high quality impact reporting which creates on-chain data around things like who did the work, what did they do, how much did they get and what was the impact created. 

The impact foundry has multiple beta testers signed up, most of them are currently grantees part of CCN round. We are also working with other grants programs for their grantees to use the tools provided by Atlantis to increase their reputation, last mile fund delivery accounting and on ground data collection.

questions.query: How does your project create value for the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Web3 Grants ecosystem struggles to measure the real world impact of many of their grantees, due to this current limitations many grantees are forced to develop code instead, because code is easier to measure. 

This is hindering the adoption of web3 in real world, with our offerings we are providing more diverse use cases for web3 grants ecosystem without sacrificing on the quality of grantees generated by different programs.

With our suite of solutions we also make it easier for non web3 communities to setup DAOs or Co-ops, this will bring a new wave of new web3 users who are interested in real world usecases outside DeFi. 

Our focus area is RWAs, ReFi, and Impact.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within Web3 grants. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation:
We have over 2 years of experience as Grantees, we deeply understand the pain points of grantees especially those who are involved in real world action. 

Our core team has hands on experience developing multi chain impact reporting and attestation mechanisms and did a successful pilot with Mercy Corps Venture in Rural India.  Link to pilot report: https://docsend.com/view/sqra3t5k7amrjgw7

The entire development team is in-house and has been building together for over 2 years now.

questions.query: How do you plan to share insights, methodologies, or tools developed through your project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community?
questions.explanation: Through Live Dashboards, Quarterly newsletter covering the different grantees who are using the Impact Miner/Foundry. We will also open source methodologies useful for grantees to gather real world data on-chain to enrich the web3 grants programs they are part of.

data.name: Cartographer Syndicate
data.description: Cartographer Syndicate

questions.query: How does your project support the mission or goals of DeSci?
questions.explanation:
An important aspect of Environmental impact accounting is the scientific development of methodologies. Today most impact assessment methodologies are centralized and expensive. 

Our products empower a decentralized peer to peer network of methodology developers (usually scientists and researchers). The Impact Miner app enables scientists and methodology developers to raise funding, run pilots with their developed methodologies, share the data gathered on ground  and distribute insights and steps to measure impact in a cost effective manner. 

Apart from decentralizing impact assessment methodologies, our second platform Impact Foundry provides a decentralized ecosystem for impact reviewing, evaluation, rewarding and storage.

questions.query: Describe how funds from the grants program will be used for your project.
questions.explanation: The additional funds from the DeSCI round will be used to further the development of web3 infrastructure that enables decentralized methodology development in environmental impact assessment.

data.text:
Impact Miner is powering citizen science around climate action. 
We have supported research bounties on Hydroponics, Water Sampling and Bee Conservation

questions.query: Impact statement - what real world problem do you solve and how
questions.explanation:
We are developing two dapps - Impact Miner and Impact Foundry. These are used by climate and social impact projects for IMPACT accounting and verification using blockchain technology. The dapps also map a range of Environmental DePins and provide new means of financial inclusion for people suffering from the climate crisis.

Impact Miner just completed its first pilot in partnership with Mercy Corps, where the blockchain-based application was used by over 3,000 locals in rural India to set up and maintain a decentralized peer-to-peer water network. This initiative helped underserved communities earn from harvesting and exchanging water in climate change-affected regions.

For more, read the report on the pilot by the Crypto Council for Innovation: link to report: https://docsend.com/view/sqra3t5k7amrjgw7

questions.query: Celo leverage - how does your project contributed to the Celo ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
We are undertaking three development projects associated with CELO:

	1.	Impact Miner users can receive and send climate bounty rewards in $cUSD.
	2.	Impact Miner users can mint Impact Certificate NFTs for verified on-ground impact using the CELO network 
	3.	The Impact Foundry uses the CELO network for third-party impact attestation

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Alfred contributes to the Open Source Software (OSS) ecosystem by lowering the barrier to designing and launching decentralized bountiesa mechanism increasingly used to incentivize OSS contributions in climate, public goods, and community-led domains.

 **Composable AI Components:** Alfred is built using open-source tools from LangChain, LangGraph, and Streamlit. We extend these components with tailored prompt engineering, memory systems, and microtask generators, which can be reused by others creating task coordination agents.

 **Enabling Purpose-Driven OSS Projects:** By offering a structured way to design and deploy sustainability-focused bounties, Alfred helps communities define actionable problems that attract open-source contributors. This creates a clear demand signal for new projects (e.g., open hardware for clean water) or for data-driven micro-contributions (e.g., geo-tagged pollution monitoring), expanding the scope of OSS beyond traditional dev tools.

 **Knowledge Infrastructure:** As Alfred evolves, it aims to integrate knowledge bases (impact frameworks, case studies, past successful OSS initiatives in climate), making it a tool that curates and disseminates open knowledge.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
**Alfred** is a smart assistant for decentralized bounty creation, focused on **climate action and sustainability use cases.**

Differentiators:
 **Structured Bounty Generator:** Instead of just brainstorming, Alfred generates a full **bounty spec**, including microtasks (action, verification, instruction), eligibility/evaluation criteria, and best practices.


 **Downloadable Outputs:** After interacting with Alfred, users get a ready-to-use Markdown spec, making it easy to share or post on bounty platforms like Atlantis or Gitcoin.


 **Domain-Specific Agent:** Unlike general-purpose agents, Alfreds prompts and behavior are **finely tuned to sustainability**, helping users focus on local relevance, clarity of impact, and measurable goals.


 **Microtask Framework:** Users can define bounties that go beyond codelike uploading geo-tagged data, creating awareness content, or collecting field evidencemaking it more inclusive to non-coders.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
**Bounty Publishing Integration ** One-click export of the generated spec to platforms like Gitcoin, Dework, or Atlantis Impact Foundry (JSON schema + Markdown).


**Bounty Templates Library ** Preloaded bounty examples (e.g., for plastic waste cleanups or rainwater harvesting audits) to help users get started faster.


**Embedded Impact Frameworks ** Let users choose from verified impact measurement models and incorporate them directly into bounty evaluation criteria.


**Multi-lingual Support ** Localized bounty generation in languages like Hindi, Swahili, and Spanish to enable wider access.

questions.query: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Atlantis is a collective that builds coordination tech with a vision to enhance climate resilience and regeneration.

In 2025, Atlantis aims to expand its user base and strengthen the adoption of its impact-focused dApps and protocols. The roadmap outlines key engineering, business development (BD), and organizational milestones.

Engineering Goals:
- Mid-April: Release of Impact Foundry v1.1 and Impact Miner v1.1, to support NFT evolution technology.
- Mid-April: Launch of Impact Landscape v.1.0
- June: Debut of Urbanika Co-Ops regenerative marketplace platform.
- August: Launch of Impact Miner v2.0, integrating Squads and Co-Op functionalities.
- July: Integration of Alfred AI with Impact Miner and Foundry to streamline operations.
- September: Release of Impact Landscape v1.1, offering full data visualization capabilities.
- October - November: Update to Impact Foundry v2.0, enhancing platform features.

BD Goals:
- April - May: Initiation of Global GreenPill NFT Campaign to foster international engagement.
- June: Secure two enterprise deals as the initial target for collaboration.
- September: Achieve eight enterprise deals, further scaling partnerships.


Organizational Goals:
- September - October: Reach 10,000 active users on Impact Miner, signifying community growth.
- November - December: Host GreenPill Festival 2025, fostering innovation and collaboration within the climate and Web 3.0 regen ecosystem.
- Till December: Host at least 8 regen events & workshops and discuss the use of web 3.0 technologies.
- By January 2026: Achieve at least 250K USD in financial flows through the Atlantis network.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoins backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.
